answers.answer: Assistance for new arrivals in Brăila includes information on managing in the city, important contacts, support programs for accommodation, meals, and integration, public transport, medical services, education, legal status, housing, safety, job support, and specialized centers for women and HIV counseling.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: You can contact the Brăila County Immigration Office by calling 0239 606 100 or by emailing br.igi@mai.gov.ro.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the section under 'Important contacts Brăila County Immigration Office'.

answers.answer: The provided content only lists contact numbers for the National Anti-Traffic Hotline Romania, but it does not specify the services they provide.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the section under 'Important contacts National Anti-Traffic Hotline Romania'.

answers.answer: The content indicates that information is required for the accommodation, meals, and integration support program, but it does not specify what information is needed.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the section under 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Brăila'.

answers.answer: The content states that you can find out how and where to buy public transport tickets in Brăila by accessing "More information", but the specific details are not provided directly.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the section under 'Public transport in Brăila'.

answers.answer: The content indicates that you can go to the County Emergency Clinical Hospital Brăila for medical services and find a list of family doctors there, but it does not list specific services offered by the hospital itself.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: The content indicates that you can find out how to enroll your child in primary education in Brăila and what documents are required by accessing "More information", but these details are not directly provided.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: The content advises exploring a map to find service providers (organizations offering support) near you in Brăila, but it does not specify the types of organizations available.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: The content mentions "Legal status" as a category of support, but it does not provide any details about the specific kind of support available for legal status in Brăila.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the section under 'Legal status'.

answers.answer: The content mentions "Housing Info" as a category, implying information about housing options is available, but it does not provide details on how to find this information or what it entails.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the section under 'Housing Info'.

answers.answer: The content mentions "Jobs Support" as a category, implying support programs for job seekers are available, but it does not provide any details about these programs.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the section under 'Jobs Support'.

answers.answer: The Women's Center provides support in accessing reproductive health services, navigating the health system, and offers services dedicated to victims of domestic violence.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: Individuals living with HIV can access free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social HIV services through specialist doctors at 10 Regional HIV Centers in Romania, with the expertise and support of Sens Pozitiv.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-braila and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.
